To discard: Destroy a card in hand that costs 2$ or more.
Effect: Unleash. Any player discards three cards in hand and then draws one card.
Flavour: "Every breath is torment." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Unleash.
Flavour: "Best to kill these first." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Effect: The player with the most prepped spells suffers 2 damage for each of their prepped spells.
Flavour: "There are no words to describe the sound of a breach opening. Only the screams echoing off the cave walls after." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: Unleash twice.
Flavour: "We toy with forces we barely comprehend." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: Gravehold suffers damage equal to this minion's current life. Then, this minion suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: The fumes they belch are so caustic that they rarely live long themselves.

Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 3 damage and draws a card.
Flavour: "It takes years to train a breach mage properly, but only a second to snuff one out." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Effect: Unleash. Gravehold suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "We have nothing left to lose but our lives." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: Nym looked up in awe as Malastar pointed to the roiling air at the dome of the cave. "Those, boy, are stars."

Effect: Unleash twice and Gravehold suffers 3 damage.#OR#Place the most recently discarded minion card in the nemesis discard pile back into play.
Flavour: "They were always just outside the edge of our knowing, sitting there in some quiet abyss just waiting to visit ruin upon us." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Special: When damage is dealt to this minion, reduce that damage to 1.
Effect: Any player suffers damage equal to this minion's current life.
Flavour: "Hack away all you like, youngling. It will only grow back another... whatever that part is." - Adelheim, Breach Mage Weaponsmith

Effect: Unleash twice. The player with the most prepped spells discards their most expensive prepped spell.
Flavour: "The words and gestures needed left him, and the breach grew dim." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "The teeth of this beast make a fine trophy. The trick is keeping all your fingers in the taking of them." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Effect: Unleash twice. Any player suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: Gravehold sat silent and forgotten for a thousand ages before The Nameless came. No one remembers for whom this vast city was built. Those stories lay in the ash outside the cave with the bones of those who once told them.

Effect: Gravehold suffers 18 damage. The players may collectively discard up to six gems. For each gem discarded this way, prevent 3 of that damage.
Flavour: "The ground absorbed the latent energy left by the first breaches ever opened. Without this to fuel our spells, our fate would be certain." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Effect: The player with the lowest life suffers 2 damage.#OR#Any player discards a prepped spell that costs 3$ or more.
Flavour: "In The World That Was, there were many creatures that used poison as a means of survival. But these things ARE poison." - Lash, Breach Mage Scout

Effect: The player with the most charges suffers 4 damage and loses all of their charges.
Flavour: "There is a saying: all wars must end." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Any player places their discard pile on top of their deck, shuffles it, and then destroys the top four cards of their deck. Then, Unleash twice.
Flavour: "The Nameless do not die, for they themselves are death." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Effect: Unleash twice.
Flavour: Jagged ones are the heralds of The Nameless, leading legions in siege after siege of Gravehold.

Effect: Unleash twice. The player with the most opened breaches destroys four cards in hand or suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "While the breaches amplify our magic a thousandfold, it comes at the highest ransom imaginable." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

To discard: Destroy two prepped spells that each cost 3$ or more.
Effect: Unleash three times.
Flavour: "The world shattered in a blink, and in the ruin I glimpsed the other side of the void." - Phaedraxa, Breach Mage Seer

Effect: Gravehold suffers 4 damage and the player with the lowest life suffers 4 damage.#OR#Shuffle all of the nemesis turn order cards into the turn order deck.
Flavour: "We fight for the lingering hope of returning to The World That Was, but in our hearts we know our future lies within these caves." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: Unleash twice. Gravehold suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "LOOK OU--", Last words of Quilion Rafe, Far Hollow watchman

Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 3 damage and may place a card in their discard pile into their hand.
Flavour: "Such wisdom comes at a considerable price." - Xaxos, Voidbringer

Effect: Unleash. Gravehold suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "Kadir remains convinced the drones were once merely creatures from The Depths."

Effect: Unleash. Reveal the top card of the turn order deck. If a player turn order card was revealed, that player suffers 2 damage. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 3 damage.
Unleash twice.#OR#Any player suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "Beyond our world is a vast nothing. At the center of this lies The Nameless." - Mist, Voidwalker

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "The sound they make as they weave echoes through the cave is like the otherworldly throes of our lost companions." - Gex, Breach Mage Advisor

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage for each spell prepped by the player with the most prepped spells.
Flavour: "Here beneath The World That Was there is no day, no time really, just night unending." - Xaxos, Voidbringer

Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 1 damage and discards their most expensive card in hand.
Flavour: "It's as if the world itself is screaming." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Unleash twice.
Flavour: "None remembered the true name of The World That Was until Yan Magda spoke it aloud: Khasad Vol."

Effect: Unleash. The players collectively discard two cards in hand.
Flavour: "The creature thrashed as it burned, its massive body collapsing into the South Wall like a hot blade through cloth." - Garu, Oathsworn Keeper

Effect: Unleash. The player with the most charges suffers 3 damage and loses all of their charges.
Flavour: "The harsh light of the dead star burned away the dark as it crept through the breach. Amd around it I saw ravaged worlds The Nameless had already claimed." - Indira, Breach Apprentice

Effect: Unleash twice. Any player places their discard pile on top of their deck and shuffles it. Then, that player reveals the top two cards of their deck and destroys the most expensive card revealed.
The player with the most opened breaches suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "It sneered as it lunged at us, an awful maw of jagged teeth eager to end one of us, if not all." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage. This minion suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "One of the few indigenous creatures of the cave, though corrupted from exposure to the breach." - Gex, Breach Mage Advisor

Effect: Unleash twice. The players collectively discard three cards in hand.
Flavour: "It churned and roiled, a maelstrom of malign power. The void was upon me and yet I felt only the throes of freedom from my prison of sleep." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

Effect: Unleash. The players collectively discard two prepped spells. Any player suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "They say that before The Nameless found Gravehold, nothing grew in these caves. It appears the cave burgeons through our blood." - Gex, Breach Mage Advisor

Effect: Unleash.
Flavour: "Quilius's first blow glanced off its carapace like breach, but her second blow carved it in twain." - Dezmodia, Voidborn Prodigy

Effect: Unleash twice. Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "One side of this struggle must fall for the other to truly live." - Xaxos, Voidbringer

Effect: Gravehold suffers 5 damage for each nemesis turn order card in the turn order discard pile.
Unleash twice. The player with the most prepped spells suffers 1 damage for each for their prepped spells.
Flavour: "Get down! It's ejecting back at us!" - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

To discard: Destroy a prepped spell that costs 5$ or more and a breach in which it was prepped.
Effect: The player with the lowest life suffers 4 damage.

Special: When damage is dealt to this minion, reduce that damage to 1.
Effect: Gravehold suffers damage equal to this minion's current life.
Flavour: "Never have I seen such a creature, even among the ranks of The Nameless." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

Effect: Resolve the most recently discarded attack card in the nemesis discard pile.
Flavour: "The Nameless rarely attack in the same fashion twice. It would seem today is an exception." - Dezmodia, Voidborn Prodigy

Effect: Gravehold suffers 7 damage.#OR#Unleash three times.
Flavour: "The Nameless hunger for the same thing we do: an end to this war." - Garu, Oathsworn Protector

Effect: Unleash twice. Any player destroys their three most expensive cards in hand.
Flavour: "Were I made of muscle and blood like the others, the impact would have surely ended me." - Remnant, Aetherial Entity

Effect: Unleash twice. The players collectively destroy the two most expensive prepped spells.
Flavour: "I watched a fellow merchant atrophy and fall to the ground in ash as the beam hit his cart." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Any player discards a prepped spell.#OR#Any player loses 1 charge.
Flavour: "It is the very breath of the void." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

Effect: Unleash twice. The player with the most expensive prepped spell places that spell on top of their deck.
Flavour: "For as massive as they are, they are quick." - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: The player with the most life suffers damage equal to their current life.

Flavour: "If you don't like choking while you cast, then stay away." - Ruya, Surface Scout

Any player suffers 3 damage and gains a Curse of Rot from the Curse deck.

Flavour: "Fear is a luxury no longer granted to the living." - Brama, Breach Mage Mentor

Special: If there is at least one husk in play, prevent all damage dealt to this minion.
Effect: Place a husk in play.
Flavour: It is the husk-mother, spewing multitudes through the void into Gravehold.

Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: "The Queen, she is the worst of their foul lot, for her young are without number." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: Place a husk into play for each turn order card in the turn order discard pile.
Flavour: The Queen wears her offspring like some writhing armor.

Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms. Unleash. Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: "Were we still in The World That Was, these wretched things would envelop the very sky." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Special: Husks have 2 life. Damaged husks heal to full life at the end of each turn.
Immediate: Unleash.
Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: It took the survivors of Gravehold half-a-moon to shovel up the dead husks and carry them into the depths, where they now lie in piles high enough to touch the tops of the cave vaults.

Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms twice.#OR#Any player suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "Husks are easy enough to dispatch... one on one, that is." - Lash, Breach Mage Scout

Immediate: Unleash twice.
Effect: Discard half of the husks in play, rounded up. Gravehold suffers 2 damage for each husks discarded this way. Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: Gravehold knows when the Queen is near, for the claxon call of her legions echoes throughout the cave.

Immediate: Unleash three times. Then, set this minion's life equal to twice the number of husks in play.
Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: "Which end is the head?" - Nym, Breach Apprentice

Effect: Carapace Queen Swarms. Unleash. Carapace Queen Swarms.
Flavour: "The sound of the things, skittering across the cave walls, is loud enough to drown our screams." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: The players collectively gain two corruptions and place them on top of their decks. Any player focuses a breach.
Flavour: "It's the only thing that smiles more than me." - Lash, Breach Mage Scout

Special: When this minion suffers damage, the player who dealt that damage gains a corruption and places it on top of their deck.
Effect: Gravehold suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: The Corrupters are but a shadow of the Crooked Mask, bringing madness to all that have endured its pollution.

Effect: The player with the most Crystals in hand discards all of their Crystals, suffers 3 damage, and gains a card from any supply pile that costs 4$ or less.
Flavour: There is a dust that fills the air when a hole is torn through the wall of the world. For some it is just that, dust. But for others, it warps the mind and grants strange power.

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage. A different player focuses a breach.
Flavour: "Even its beasts seem to delight in lunacy." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

To discard: Discard four cards in hand and draw one card.
Effect: Gravehold gains 3 life. Crooked Mask gains 13 life.
Flavour: "Is it laughing at us?" - Nym, Breach Apprentice

Effect: Discard the top two cards of the nemesis deck. For each tier 3 nemesis card discarded this way, Gravehold suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "It is one thing to swing a sword or beckon flame from the void. But it is another act indeed to fight blinding madness from within." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Two different players each gain two corruptions and place them on top of their decks. Each of those player gains 1 life.
Flavour: "It was as if a whisper echoed behind my eyes, tempting me to stray into the raw abyss," - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Effect: Gravehold gains 2 life. The player with the most life suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "Employing a complex stratagem against such an unpredictable foe is beyond foolish. Instinct is our only and best weapon." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: Any player discards three non-corruption cards. That player gains three corruptions and places them into their hand.
Flavour: "In the dark, there is a light. And in madness, there is reason." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Effect: Suffer 1 damage. You may destroy a non-corruption card in hand. Destroy this.
Flavour: "Our lives matter not in the end. We are mere fodder to these beings, an inconvenient obstacle, no more. What matters is that we take them with us when we go back to oblivion." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: Suffer 1 damage. Return any card that costs 0$ in your discard pile to your hand. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask brings a sickness that spreads, like black wings, across a mage's mind.

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage. Focus a breach. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask grants a power too vast to be contained.

Effect: Gain a spell from any spell supply pile. Gain three corruptions and place them on top of your deck. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask enhances magical abilities even as it scatters the wits.

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage. Gain 2 life. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask bestows an empty greed that cannot be slaked.

Effect: Suffer 1 damage. Deal 2 damage. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask preaches pain as a virtue.

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage. Reveal the top card of your deck. You may destroy it. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask guides all toward oblivion.

Effect: Suffer 2 damage. Gain a gem from the least expensive supply pile and place it into your hand. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask blesses the covetous.

Effect: Suffer 1 damage. Gain 1 charge. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask venerates those who wield destruction.

Effect: Discard two non-corruption cards. Suffers 2 damage. Shuffle any player's turn order card into the turn order deck. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask shackles the self.

Effect: Gain a relic from any relic supply pile and place it on top of your deck. Suffer damage equal to half its cost, rounded up. Destroy this.
Flavour: The Crooked Mask consumes our fear of extermination.

Effect: Devour two cards from the second most expensive gem supply pile. Any player suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "So much of our history was lost in the first Purge. Aeons of knowledge, art, and culture erased. It has been so very long that we know not even the true name of The World That Was." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Any player suffers 3 damage.#OR#Devour three spells from any spell supply pile.
Flavour: "I saw the woman's eyes empty and everything she was fall away into nothing." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage.#OR#Devour two relics from the least expensive relic supply pile.
Flavour: "Is it eating the cave wall?" - Nym, Breach Apprentice

Effect: Devour cards equal to this minion's life from one supply pile. Then, this minion suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "Quickly. Before our heads are hollow." - Adelheim, Breach Mage Weaponsmith

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage. Devour a gem from the most expensive gem supply pile.
Flavour: The Prince exploits these creatures to both mend its wounds and sate its hunger.

Immediate: Set this minion's life equal to 8 plus the number of empty supply piles.
Effect: Unleash.
Unleash three times.#OR#Any player suffers damage equal to the number of empty supply piles.
Flavour: The Prince feasts on the memories of those left in Gravehold, consuming their very histories.

Effect: The player with the lowest life suffers damage equal to the number of empty supply piles.
Flavour: "Sometimes I think it a blessing to have forgotten so much of my past." - Phaedraxa, Breach Mage Seer

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage for each empty supply pile.
Flavour: "It aims to make us forget what is at stake." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Effect: Rageborne Strikes.
Flavour: Thraxir was breach commander for as long as most could remember. To honor him, to this very day no man or woman has been elected to the post in his stead.

Effect: Gravehold suffers damage equal to the number of Fury tokens Rageborne has.
Flavour: "I nearly wasted a freshly forged chopper on one of these things." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Effect: Unleash. If there are two nemesis turn order cards in the turn order discard pile, Unleash two additional times.
Flavour: "I reckon its head would look good on a post." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Effect: Unleash four times.
Flavour: The cave walls crumble and quake as it bellows to its kin.

Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 1 damage. That player suffers 1 additional damage for each Fury token Rageborne has.
Flavour: "There is but a single power among The Nameless that can shatter Gravehold." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage.#OR#Unleash twice.
Flavour: "Part of me almost admires the craftmanship of this horrible thing." - Adelheim, Breach Mage Weaponsmith

Effect: Rageborne Strikes.
Flavour: Many a mage found their end in the gullet of this beast.

Effect: Unleash three times. The players collectively discard cards in hand equal to the number of Fury tokens Rageborne has.
Flavour: Even its shadow leaves a wake of carnage, smoke, and screams.

Effect: Rageborne Strikes twice.
Flavour: "Its breath rasped as it turned the black rocks red. And those who could, ran." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: Any player suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "No other thing, in our world or theirs, has been so violent as this beast." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Gravehold suffers 5 damage.
Flavour: "Anger is born in fire." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: The player with the lowest life suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "The breach commander Thraxir was split in twain with a single blow, his armor twisted and glowing like a brand. I have never seen such a thing before or since." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: The player with the most opened breaches suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "All great armies have a warrior that is feared above all others. We call theirs Rageborne." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage. Any player suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "The fire spread from the old barracks to the south wall in a moment, the ancient stone hissing and turning black as the beast strode through the city." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: The players collectively discard the two most expensive prepped spells.
Flavour: "How this cave has not long ago collapsed is a wonder and a mercy." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: If there are no troggs in play, Unleash twice. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 2 damage for each trogg in play.
Flavour: "If only they knew they were our forefathers, perhaps they would relent." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Unleash twice. Then, discard a trogg in play.
Flavour: "They wait until we slumber, slithering through the caves without a sound." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Unleash. The players collectively discard gems equal to the number of troggs in play.
Flavour: In The World That Was, there were myths of ancients, now lost to us, that walked the primordial wastes. They built Gravehold as a sanctuary from the chaos. The elders called them troggs.

Immediate: Unleash. This minion becomes a trogg of the type that has the most of its type in play. When this is discarded, place it in Horde-Crone's discard pile.
Unleash twice.
Effect: Any player suffers 1 damage for each trogg in play.
Flavour: "They're rather making a mess of this home they want so badly." - Lash, Breach Mage Scout

Effect: Unleash four times. Then, discard two troggs in play.
Flavour: "One need only look in their hollow eyes to know their aim." - Adelheim, Breach Mage Weaponsmith

Effect: Unleash twice. If there are three or fewer troggs in play, Unleash again until there are four troggs in play.
Flavour: The Horde-Crone has stirred the lost tribes from the bones of memory with a new, single-minded purpose: to reclaim Gravehold.

Special: When a player deals damage, that player must deal damage to a trogg if there are any troggs in play.
Immediate: Unleash twice.
Effect: Unleash twice.
Flavour: The Troggs wandered the caves for aeons. Deep within the rock and shadow, they found their deity sleeping.

Effect: Unleash twice. Resolve the effect of each of the troggs placed into play by this card one additional time.
Flavour: "As long as they bleed..." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Special: #2 Orps: Gravehold suffers 2 damage.#3 Orps: Gravehold suffers 3 damage.#4 Orps: Gravehold suffers 5 damage. Discard all Orps.#
#2 Yuds: Any player suffers 2 damage.#3 Yuds: Any player suffers 3 damage.#4 Yuds: The player with the lowest life suffers 4 damage. Discard all Yuds.#
#2 Zoms: The player with the lowest life suffers 1 damage.#3 Zoms: Any player discards 3 cards.#4 Zoms: Gravehold suffers 1 damage for each trogg in play. Discard all Zoms.#

Effect: Any player gains a Tainted Jade and places it in their hand. Advance the Tainted Track.
Flavour: "Just outside the city walls there are men and women, frozen in green horror, like monuments to the Blight Lord's coming." - Z'hana, Breach Mage Renegade

Effect: Gravehold suffers 2 damage. Any player gains a Tainted Jade and places it on top of their deck.
Flavour: "Renny Mumbast lost both eyes to these wretched things. So now, when the warning bells sound the Blight Lord's call, we wear goggles." - Mist, Breach Mage Dagger Captain

Effect: The players collectively gain two Tainted Jades and place them into their hands.
Flavour: The elders of Gravehold thought it wise to pave the streets of the dirt market in tumbled breach glass.

Effect: Advance the Tainted Track twice.
Flavour: "If it just touches your arm, count yourself lucky. Just chop the limb off before it's too late." - Reeve, Breach Mage Elite

Effect: The players collectively gain three Tainted Jades and place them on top of their decks.
Flavour: The Blight Lord's touch is enough to crystallize anything, living or otherwise.

Effect: Any player suffers 3 damage. If this minion has 8 or less life, advance the Tainted Track.
Flavour: "It's great that they shatter so easily, but not so much when they explode." - Lash, Breach Mage Scout

Effect: Any player discards three cards in hand and then gains three Tainted Jades and places them into their hand.
Flavour: "Malastar is convinced The Nameless seek to change us and then harvest us for some soul purpose." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: Advance the Tainted Track twice.#OR#Gravehold suffers 8 damage.
Flavour: "The elders say all worlds are born of dust. Perhaps it is fitting that we return to such." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Effect: Any player gains two Tainted Jades. Advance the Tainted Track.
Flavour: The Nameless bring with them legions of monstrosities. But the Blight Lord's favorites are the ones he breathes to life from the cave walls." - Kadir, Breach Mage Delver

Special: This minion is aligned to III.
Effect: Any player loses 1 charge or suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: The Wayward One is a shepherd of sorts, guiding an army of lost horrors.

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage. Any player discards a misaligned prepped spell.
Flavour: After the Wayward One had wandered back through the breach, the survivors of Gravehold were afflicted with strange maladies. One poor boy seemed to shift out of the world, only to return, screaming, hours later.

Effect: If any player has an aligned spell, a player with an aligned spell suffers 5 damage.
Flavour: "It is the Void and everything within it." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Effect: The player with the most misaligned prepped spells suffers 3 damage and discards two cards.
Flavour: "It seems trapped between their world and ours, not quite belonging to either." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Effect: Shift Wayward One to IV. Gravehold suffers 8 damage. The players may collectively discard up to 2 aligned spells. For each spell discarded this way, prevent 4 of that damage.
Flavour: "Within its twisted form, I saw the ragged teeth of infinity." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Special: This minion is aligned to IV. When a player deals damage, that player must deal damage to this minion.
Flavour: "How is this thing still alive?" - Nym, Breach Apprentice

Effect: If any player has two or more misaligned spells, a player with or more misaligned prepped spells suffers 7 damage.
Flavour: "It is a being lost in agony as much as it is a monster." - Xaxos, Breach Mage Adept

Special: This minion is aligned to II. Prevent all damage dealt to Wayward One.
Effect: Any player destroys a breach. Gravehold suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: The Wayward One differs from the others in many ways, but its odd beasts are lethal nonetheless.

Effect: Any player suffers 5 damage.#OR#The player with the most prepped spells destroys all of their prepped spells.
Flavour: There are charred bones fused with the cave floor, all that is left from those it has touched.

Effect: Each Player suffers 1 damage for each turn order card that player has in the turn order discard pile.
Flavour: It is said that each abomination is but the same creature from across all worlds twisted into a single form.

Effect: Any player suffers damage equal to the number of nemesis tokens Gate Witch has. Unleash. Place this card on the bottom of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "Time is The Witch's domain, the one thing we have so little left." - Gex, Breach Mage Adviser

Effect: Unleash. Gate Witch draws an additional card during the nemesis draw phase this turn.
Choose any player's turn order card in the turn order discard pile. Shuffle the rest of the turn order cards into the turn order deck.
Flavour: "Within the void, there are infinite spirals of worlds. Some are unborn, others are thriving. But there is a dead light in some that have been claimed by The Nameless." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

Effect: Gravehold suffers damage equal to the number of nemesis tokens Gate Witch has.
Flavour: "It moves between time and space, too quick for the eye and harder yet to strike." - Remnant, Aethereal Entity

Special: When this minion is discarded from play, shuffle a nemesis turn order card into the turn order deck.
Effect: The player with the most charges suffers 2 damage.
Unleash. Reveal the top card of the turn order deck. If a player turn order card is revealed, discard it. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 5 damage. Place this card on the bottom of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "Being pushed out of time is a painful ordeal even for me." - Remnant, Aethereal Entity

Effect: Unleash until Gate Witch has six nemesis tokens. Place this card on the bottom of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "Countless times we have won. And countless more we have lost." - Mazahaedron, Henge Mystic

Special: When this minion is discarded from play or the nemesis deck, place it on the bottom of the nemesis deck.
Effect: Any player suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "It lives outside of time and therefore cannot be slain." - Garu, Oathsworn Protector

Effect: Place the acolyte in play with the lowest life on the bottom of the acolyte deck. Draw an acolyte. Unleash.
Flavour: The Hollow Crown gestured to the acolyte, who removed its mask and walked into the blinding light within the breach.

Effect: Resolve the Blood Magic effect of each acolyte in play without those acolytes suffering damage from their Blood Magic effects.
Flavour: It has but one weapon: blind obedience.

Effect: Resolve the Blood Magic effect of the acolyte with the lowest life. That acolyte suffers 1 additional damage.
Unleash. The acolyte with the lowest life gains 10 life. Resolve that acolyte's Blood Magic effect.
Flavour: "Perhaps it is not our doom, Brama. Perhaps it is our very maker." - Xaxos, Voidbringer

Effect: Draw an acolyte. Resolve the Blood Magic effect of each acolute in play without those acolytes suffering damage from their Blood Magic effects.
Resolve the Blood Magic effect of the acolyte with the most life. That acolyte suffers 6 additional damage. Unleash twice.
Flavour: As it passed through the city, men and women dropped to their knees faithfully, their eyes heavy with tears of awe.

Effect: Resolve the Blood Magic effect of each acolyte in play without those acolytes suffering damage from their Blood Magic effects. Repeat this one additional time.
Flavour: "Behind their masks is nothing, youngling. They have made their choice." - Gex, Breach Mage Adviser

Effect: Shuffle the two most recently discarded acolytes in the acolyte discard into the acolyte deck. Resolve the Blood Magic effect of each acolyte in play without those acolytes suffering damage from their Blood Magic effects.
The acolyte with the lowest life gains 10 life. Resolve that acolyte's Blood Magic effect twice.
Flavour: "All kinds must have a queen." - Dezmodia, Voidborn Prodigy

Effect: Gravehold and this minion suffer 1 damage for each spell prepped by the player with the most prepped spells.
Flavour: "We find wisdom in their great cruelty"

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage. Then, if that player has 5 life or less, this minion suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "We become that which is most feared."

Effect: Two different players each suffer 1 damage.
Flavour: "We renounce our existence behind each mask."

Effect: Gravehold suffers 1 damage. Any player suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "We hunger to be nothing."

Effect: The player with the lowest life suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "We cull the weak to feed the worthy."

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage.#OR#Any player loses 1 charge, Gravehold suffers 1 damage, and this minion suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "We wipe the sister-words from our tongues to taste oblivion."

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage. This minion suffers 1 damage.
Flavour: "We cast aside the haven that has become our shackle."

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage.#OR#Any player suffers 1 damage and discards their most expensive card in hand.
Flavour: "We honor the void in blood."

Effect: Any player discards 2 cards in hand. This minion suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "We wield the breach in reverance to those from beyond it."

Special: When this minion is dealt damage, Magus of Cleaks gains one nemesis token.
Effect: Any player loses 1 charge or suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "It is shadow, given form and cruelty." - Mazahaedron, Henge Mystic

Special: When Magus of Cloaks is dealt damage, discard this.
Effect: Unleash. Any player suffers 3 damage. Any player destroys a prepped spell that costs 0$.
Flavour: "Worlds are born and die in dark." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

Effect: Gravehold suffers damage equal to the number of nemesis tokens Magus of Cloaks has. Then, Magus of Cloaks gains one nemesis token.

Special: When this minion is dealt damage, prevent 2 of that damage.
Effect: Any player suffers damage equal to half the number of nemesis tokens Magus of Cloaks has, rounded up.
Flavour: "If any among us can kill the dark itself, it is Quilius." - Garu, Oathsworn Protector

Special: When Magus of Cloaks is dealt damage, discard this.
Effect: Unleash twice. Any player suffers 3 damage and discards a prepped spell.
Flavour: "I could not tell if Ulgimor was afraid or simply angry. Can a shadow feel such things?" - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Magus of Cloaks gains four nemesis tokens. The players collectively destroy two prepped spells that cost 0$.
Flavour: "The shadows rose and swallowed what little light there was." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Magus of Cloaks gains five nemesis tokens. The player with the most expensive prepped spell destroys that spell and suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "We live in darkness, but they thrive in it." - Mist, Voidwalker

Immediate: Magus of Cloaks gains four nemesis tokens.
Effect: Magus of Cloaks reaches its final form. Humanity is wiped out. The players lose the game.
Flavour: "What little light we have shall be smothered in the end." - Nerva, Survivor

Special: When this minion is dealt damage, reduce that damage by the number of nemesis tokens Magus of Cloaks has.
Effect: The player with the most charges suffers 4 damage.
Flavour: "Where Ulgimor is merely a beast of shadow, the Veil Daughter is a darkling goddess." - Dezmodia, Voidborn Prodigy

Effect: The player with the most expensive prepped spell discards that spell.#OR#Umbra Titan loses one nemesis token.
Flavour: "The beasts of this cave seem to revere The Titan as though it were some ancient god." - Mazahaedron, Henge Mystic

Effect: If the nemesis has two turn order cards in the turn order discard pile, Umbra Titan loses one nemesis token. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "Kick it, stab it, burn it... the thing just keeps grinning." - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: Umbra Titan loses two nemesis tokens.
Flavour: "I roared as it bore through the rock. And Gravehold shuddered like those within its walls." - Nerva, Survivor

Effect: The players collectively destroy the two most expensive prepped spells.#OR#Umbra Titan loses two nemesis tokens.
If Umbra Titan has 5 or more nemesis tokens, it loses a nemesis token. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "With two heads, it's twice as eager to make a meal of a mage." - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: Any player suffers 2 damage. If this minion has 8 or less life, Umbra Titan loses one nemesis token.
Flavour: The air rasping in its massive lungs is enough to burst your eardrums.

Effect: Umbra Titan loses three nemesis tokens.#OR#Unleash. Place the most recently discarded minion in the nemesis discard pile back into play.
Umbra Titan loses one nemesis token.
Flavour: "In the time before ours, their kind thrived in the tumult of the fledgling world. Now, they seek a new home among The Nameless." - Mazahaedron, Henge Mystic

Effect: Any player suffers 6 damage.#OR#Umbra Titan loses three nemesis tokens.
Flavour: The Titan hides beneath the skin of the cave, emerging only to strike.

Effect: Gravehold suffers 3 damage.#OR#Knight of Shackles focuses its breach II.
Flavour: "Dirt is precious here, so we bury our dead in the darkness of The Depths. Or so we thought..." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: If Knight of Shackles's breach I is open, any player suffers 4 damage. Otherwise, Unleash twice.
Unleash twice. Any player focuses their breach III.
Flavour: "Only a breach mage would know Gravehold so well." - Gex, Breach Mage Adviser

Immediate: Knight of Shackles focuses its breach III.
Effect: Any player suffers 1 damage. That player suffers 1 additional damage for each opened breach Knight of Shackles has.
Flavour: It strode confidently among the dead upon its blighted steed, the glow of the breach radiating from it as they sieged the city.

Effect: Any player suffers 1 damage. That player suffers 2 additional damage for each opened breach Knight of Shackles has. Unleash.
Flavour: "If Thraxir can become one of them, so can I." - Xaxos, Voidbringer

Effect: If Knight of Shackles's breach I is open, Gravehold suffers 6 damage. Otherwise, Knight of Shackles opens its breach I.
Flavour: "Mist refuses to see Thraxir within this thing, but it's quite clear to the rest of us." - Gex, Breach Mage Adviser

Special: Players cannot rotate Knight of Shackles's breaches.
Effect: Gravehold suffers 1 damage. Gravehold suffers 1 additional damage for each opened breach Knight of Shackles has.

To discard: Destroy three cards in hand that each cost 3$ or more.
Effect: Knight of Shackles opens its closed breach with the lowest focus cost.
Flavour: Thraxir was once a breach mage commander, torn asunder by the one called Rageborne. Now he is a harbinger for The Nameless, the end of all.

Effect: If Knight of Shackles's breach II is closed, Knight of Shackles opens that breach. Otherwise, for each opened breach Knight of Shackles has, place the most recently discarded power card into player with the number of power tokens indicated on the card.
Unleash. The players collectively discard cards in hand equal to the number of cards in the Thorn supply pile. Advance.
Flavour: "It was as if a splinter was driven into my brain. And the words necessary to fight back were all but lost to me." - Indira, Breach Apprentice

Effect: If the Thorn supply pile is a spell, Advance. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "Imagine a knife with winds... and teeth." - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: Unleash. If the Thorn supply pile is a spell, Advance. Otherwise, the player with the most expensive prepped spell discards that spell.
Flip the Thorn marker over. Unleash.
Flavour: "A swarm of these descended upon the dirt market once. What I wouldn't give to forget that day." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Unleash. Destroy all of the cards in the two supply piles with the fewest cards.
Flavour: The Maiden clambered upon the fallen mage, seeming to devour her throes like nectar.

Effect: The player with the most expensive gem in hand discards that gem and suffers 2 damage.
Flavour: "Let's let Quilius have this one." - Garu, Oathsworn Protector

Effect: Unleash twice. Any player draws two cards and then destroys all cards in hand that cost 2$ or more.
Destroy all of the cards in the two supply piles with the fewest cards. Unleash twice.
Any player suffers damage equal to the cost of the top card of the Thorn supply pile.
Flavour: It writhed as it ripped a hole through the wall of the world, snatching up those not deft enough to run away.

Effect: Any player suffers 1 damage. Thrice-Dead Prophet gains one nemesis token.
Flavour: "It feeds on our belief that we may somehow survive." - Garu, Oathsworn Protector

Effect: If Thrice-Dead Prophet has 40 or less life, Gravehold suffers 7 damage. Otherwise, Thrice-Dead Prophet gains three nemesis tokens.
Flavour: "The first time we killed it, we were surprised. The second time, we rejoiced. The third time, we had Quilius kill it again to be certain." - Dezmodia, Voidborn Prodigy

Effect: Any player suffers 4 damage. Thrice-Dead Prophet gains one nemesis token.
Flavour: "I thought it dead... for a moment." - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: If Thrice-Dead Prophet has 40 or less life, Unleash three times. Otherwise, it gains three nemesis tokens.
Any player suffers 4 damage. Thrice-Dead Prophet gains three nemesis token.
If Thrice-Dead Prophet has 40 or less life, it gains 7 life. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 3 damage.
Flavour: "I would assume this is its bodyguard?" - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: If Thrice-Dead Prophet has 30 or less life, Unleash four times. Otherwise, discard the top card of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "How many times can these things die?!" - Sparrow, Breach Mage Soldier

Effect: Discard the top card of the nemesis deck.
Flavour: "All around us, the world unhinged and shattered. Life and death lost all meaning a time became obsolete." - Mazahaedron, Henge Mystic

Effect: If Thrice-Dead Prophet has 30 or less life, Unleash and the players collectively discard the three most expensive prepped spells. Otherwise, the players collectively suffer 9 damage.
Any player resolves the highest numbered unclaimed Terror tile without claiming it.
Flavour: It slides between the world of the working and that of dreams, a graceful nightmare given form.

Effect: Any player resolves the two highest numbered unclaimed Terror tiles in any order without claiming them.
Flavour: The cacophony of their screams filled the dirt market, each person falling to their knees in utter horror.

Effect: Unleash. The player with the lowest numbered claimed Terror tile resolves that Terror tile.
Flavour: "A wake of dread was upon our hearts like an unseen hand." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: The player with the fewest Terror tiles claims the three highest numbered unclaimed Terror tiles without resolving them.#OR#Any player loses 1 charge and suffers 4 damage.
Unleash. Remove the highest numbered claimed Terror tile from the game.
Flavour: "As Gravehold slept, Wraithmonger hovered about the city like an omen of the terror that was yet to come." - Indira, Breach Apprentice

Effect: Unleash. Any player loses 1 charge.
Flavour: "It would not be as terrifying were it any less beautiful." - Ohat, Dirt Merchant

Effect: Unleash. Remove the highest numbered claimed Terror tile from the game.
Flavour: "The Wraithmonger is a being of pure fear, interred without our very sleep. Let us wake for fear that we may dream." - Yan Magda, Enlightened Exile

To discard: Destroy two prepped spells that each cost 3$ or more.
Effect: The player with the fewest Terror tiles claims all of the Terror tiles except for the lowest numbered Terror tile without resolving them.

The player with the most charges loses all of their charges. That player claims the two highest numbered Terror tiles even if they are already claimed. Then, that player resolves all of their Terror tiles in any order.
Unleash.
Gravehold suffers 2 damage. Any player discards a prepped spell.
Gravehold suffers 4 damage. Any player discards a card in hand.
Unleash. The players collectively discard three cards in hand.
Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
Gravehold suffers 3 damage.
Unleash twice. The player with the most expensive prepped spell discards that spell.
Gravehold suffers 6 damage.
Any player destroys a prepped spell and discards a card in hand.

Special: This minion can never have less than 1 life. This minion has no maximum life.

Effect: Any player discards a card in hand.
Gravehold suffers 2 damage.
The player with the lowest life suffers 1 damage.
Gravehold suffers 1 damage.
Breeding Chamber gains 2 life.
Any player suffers 2 damage.
The player with the fewest opened breaches suffers 2 damage.
Resolve the persistent effect of the pod with the most life three times.#OR#Breeding Chamber gains 5 life.
If there are no pods in play, Breeding Chamber gains 5 life. Otherwise, Gravehold suffers 4 damage.
Draw a card from the pod deck and place it into play. Then, set that minion's life to 2. (This does not affect shield tokens.)

To discard: Discard two gems that cost 3$ or more.
Effect: Resolve the persistent effect of the pod with the most life four times.#OR#Breeding Chamber gains 5 life and any player suffers 2 damage.
The player with the lowest life suffers 5 damage.
If there are no pods in play, Breeding Chamber gains 8 life. Otherwise, any player suffers 4 damage.
Draw a card from the pod deck and place it into play.#OR#Gravehold suffers 6 damage.
Draw two cards from the pod deck and place them into play. (Do not resolve these minions' PERSISTENT effects this turn.)

Special: Prevent all damage dealt to pods.
Effect: Unleash twice.
Unleash twice. Any player discards two gems in hand. That player focuses their closed breach with the lowest focus cost.
Unleash twice. Any player destroys a prepped spell that costs 0$.
Any player discards two gems, gains a charge, and suffers 2 damage.
Unleash. Fungal Mesh gains 3 life.
Unleash twice. Any player discards three gems and suffers 2 damage. Then, that player gains a card that costs 3$ or less from any supply pile.
The player with the most expensive prepped spell casts it. The damage that spell deals must be dealt to the player who cast it.
Unleash three times. The player with the lowest life discards their hand, shuffles their discard pile into their deck, and then draws five cards.
The player with the most prepped spells suffers 4 damage.
Unleash twice. The player with the most opened breaches discards their hand, gains a card that costs 5$ or less, and places that card into their hand.
Gravehold suffers 1 damage. Any player discards a gem.
Gravehold suffers 3 damage. The player with the most expensive spell in hand degrades that card.
Gravehold suffers 2 damage. The player with the most Crystals in hand places a flawed sticker on a non-flawed Crystal in their hand or discard pile.
